creator: RonFrtek
title: Controlling LED Brightness With a Potentiometer and OLED Display
description: This project demonstrates how to control LED brightness using a potentiometer, with the corresponding potentiometer value displayed on an OLED display. The project utilizes an Arduino and the Visuino visual programming environment.
steps: Connect the potentiometer to the Arduino. Connect the potentiometer's [DTB] pin to the Arduino's analog pin [A0], the [VCC] pin to the Arduino's [5V] pin, and the [GND] pin to the Arduino's [GND] pin.
Connect the LED to the Arduino. Connect the LED's positive pin to the Arduino's digital pin [10] and the LED's negative pin to the Arduino's [GND] pin.

Connect the OLED display to the Arduino. Connect the OLED display's [VCC] pin to the Arduino's [5V] pin, the [GND] pin to the Arduino's [GND] pin, the [SDA] pin to the Arduino's [SDA] pin, and the [SCL] pin to the Arduino's [SCL] pin.
Start Visuino and select the Arduino UNO board type from the Tools menu.

In Visuino, add an OLED display component and connect the Arduino's AnalogIn pin [0] to the OLED display's Text Field 1 pin In and the OLED display's I2C Out pin to the Arduino's I2C In pin. Connect Arduino AnalogIn pin[Out] to Arduino Digital [10] pin - Analog (PWM)
In Visuino, generate, compile, and upload the Arduino code by pressing F9 or clicking the appropriate button. Then, open the Arduino IDE and click the upload button.
Power the Arduino. Rotating the potentiometer will change the LED brightness, and the potentiometer's value will be shown on the OLED display.
